data.quote: I am very optimistic, and I wish that God almighty grants me success to get a qualifying time. Only then can I go to the Olympics. If this happens I will be the first Palestinian athlete to gain a qualifying time. This will be a big achievement.
data.author: Nader al-Masri

data.quote: Integrity is so perishable in the summer months of success.
data.author: Vanessa Redgrave

data.quote: Success is not a place at which one arrives but rather the spirit with which one undertakes and continues the journey.
data.author: Alex Noble

data.quote: A strong passion for any object will ensure success, for the desire of the end will point out the means.
data.author: Henry Hazlitt

data.quote: Success is an absurd, erratic thing. She arrives when one least expects her and after she has come may depart again almost because of a whim.
data.author: Alice Foote MacDougall

data.quote: It's not enough that I should succeed - others should fail.
data.author: David Merrick

data.quote: Pure mathematics is, in its way, the poetry of logical ideas.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: Poetry is when an emotion has found its thought and the thought has found words.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: Painting is silent poetry, and poetry is painting that speaks.
data.author: Plutarch

data.quote: Poetry is an echo, asking a shadow to dance.
data.author: Carl Sandburg

data.quote: Poetry is not a turning loose of emotion, but an escape from emotion; it is not the expression of personality, but an escape from personality. But, of course, only those who have personality and emotions know what it means to want to escape from these things.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: A poet is a nightingale, who sits in darkness and sings to cheer its own solitude with sweet sounds.
data.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

data.quote: As things are, and as fundamentally they must always be, poetry is not a career, but a mug's game. No honest poet can ever feel quite sure of the permanent value of what he has written: He may have wasted his time and messed up his life for nothing.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: There's a certain line between jokes and music and poetry that's a bit blurred in my mind.
data.author: Bo Burnham

data.quote: Immature poets imitate mature poets steal.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: You can find poetry in your everyday life, your memory, in what people say on the bus, in the news, or just what's in your heart.
data.author: Carol Ann Duffy

data.quote: If your daily life seems poor, do not blame it; blame yourself that you are not poet enough to call forth its riches; for the Creator, there is no poverty.
data.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

data.quote: From the beginnings of literature, poets and writers have based their narratives on crossing borders, on wandering, on exile, on encounters beyond the familiar. The stranger is an archetype in epic poetry, in novels. The tension between alienation and assimilation has always been a basic theme.
data.author: Jhumpa Lahiri

data.quote: When it comes to atoms, language can be used only as in poetry. The poet, too, is not nearly so concerned with describing facts as with creating images.
data.author: Niels Bohr

data.quote: Poetry, even when apparently most fantastic, is always a revolt against artifice, a revolt, in a sense, against actuality.
data.author: James Joyce

data.quote: Poetry and music are very good friends. Like mommies and daddies and strawberries and cream - they go together.
data.author: Nikki Giovanni

data.quote: Poetry is the lifeblood of rebellion, revolution, and the raising of consciousness.
data.author: Alice Walker

data.quote: I'm a great believer in poetry out of the classroom, in public places, on subways, trains, on cocktail napkins. I'd rather have my poems on the subway than around the seminar table at an MFA program.
data.author: Billy Collins

data.quote: Poetry is like a bird, it ignores all frontiers.
data.author: Yevgeny Yevtushenko

data.quote: Writing a book of poetry is like dropping a rose petal down the Grand Canyon and waiting for the echo.
data.author: Don Marquis

data.quote: Poetry is the revelation of a feeling that the poet believes to be interior and personal which the reader recognizes as his own.
data.author: Salvatore Quasimodo

data.quote: I was reading the dictionary. I thought it was a poem about everything.
data.author: Steven Wright

data.quote: Poetry surrounds us everywhere, but putting it on paper is, alas, not so easy as looking at it.
data.author: Vincent Van Gogh

data.quote: Cotton was a force of nature. There's a poetry to it, hoeing and growing cotton.
data.author: B. B. King

data.quote: Daydreaming is one of the key sources of poetry - a poem often starts as a daydream that finds its way into language - and walking seems to bring a different sort of alertness, an associative kind of thinking, a drifting state of mind.
data.author: Edward Hirsch

data.quote: Poetry is not a matter of feelings, it is a matter of language. It is language which creates feelings.
data.author: Umberto Eco

data.quote: Hip-hop is about the brilliance of pavement poetry.
data.author: Michael Eric Dyson

data.quote: If you have so earth-creeping a mind that it cannot lift itself up to look to the sky of poetry... thus much curse I must send you, in the behalf of all poets, that while you live, you live in love, and never get favour for lacking skill of a sonnet; and, when you die, your memory die from the earth for want of an epitaph.
data.author: Philip Sidney

data.quote: Poetry should... should strike the reader as a wording of his own highest thoughts, and appear almost a remembrance.
data.author: John Keats

data.quote: Poetry is language at its most distilled and most powerful.
data.author: Rita Dove

data.quote: We go to poetry, we go to literature in general, to be forwarded within ourselves.
data.author: Seamus Heaney

data.quote: Poetry is the one place where people can speak their original human mind. It is the outlet for people to say in public what is known in private.
data.author: Allen Ginsberg

data.quote: Listen, real poetry doesn't say anything; it just ticks off the possibilities. Opens all doors. You can walk through any one that suits you.
data.author: Jim Morrison

data.quote: It may be said that poems are in one way like icebergs: only about a third of their bulk appears above the surface of the page.
data.author: Howard Nemerov

data.quote: A poet's work is to name the unnameable, to point at frauds, to take sides, start arguments, shape the world, and stop it going to sleep.
data.author: Salman Rushdie

data.quote: Poetry is thoughts that breathe, and words that burn.
data.author: Thomas Gray

data.quote: Poetry is emotion, passion, love, grief - everything that is human. It is not for zombies by zombies.
data.author: F. Sionil Jose

data.quote: America's liberal arts universities have long been safe zones for leftist thinking, protected ivory towers for the pseudo-elite who earn their livings writing papers nobody reads about gender roles in the poetry of Maya Angelou.
data.author: Ben Shapiro

data.quote: I gave up on new poetry myself 30 years ago when most of it began to read like coded messages passing between lonely aliens in a hostile world.
data.author: Russell Baker

data.quote: Nobody, I think, ought to read poetry, or look at pictures or statues, who cannot find a great deal more in them than the poet or artist has actually expressed. Their highest merit is suggestiveness.
data.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

data.quote: Poetry is the art of substantiating shadows, and of lending existence to nothing.
data.author: Edmund Burke

data.quote: I know some people might think it odd - unworthy even - for me to have written a cookbook, but I make no apologies. The U.S. poet laureate Billy Collins thought I had demeaned myself by writing poetry for Hallmark Cards, but I am the people's poet so I write for the people.
data.author: Maya Angelou

data.quote: There are still many tribal cultures where poetry and song, there is just one word for them. There are other cultures with literacy where poetry and song are distinguished. But poetry always remembers that it has its origins in music.
data.author: Edward Hirsch

data.quote: I have not the slightest pretension to call my verses poetry I write now and then for no other purpose than to relieve depression or to improve my English.
data.author: Alfred Nobel

data.quote: Sri Lanka is an island that everyone loves at some level inside themselves. A very special island that travellers, from Sinbad to Marco Polo, dreamed about. A place where the contours of the land itself forms a kind of sinewy poetry.
data.author: Romesh Gunesekera

data.quote: If what distinguishes us from other species is speech, then poetry, which is the supreme linguistic operation, is our anthropological - indeed, genetic - goal.
data.author: Joseph Brodsky

data.quote: I cannot speak for more than an hour exclusively about poetry. At that point, life itself takes over again.
data.author: Wislawa Szymborska

data.quote: Spoken word poetry is the art of performance poetry. I tell people it involves creating poetry that doesn't just want to sit on paper, that something about it demands it be heard out loud or witnessed in person.
data.author: Sarah Kay

data.quote: Poetry is what we do to break bread with the dead.
data.author: Seamus Heaney

data.quote: The poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.
data.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

data.quote: Who writes poetry imbibes honey from the poisoned lips of life.
data.author: William Rose Benet

data.quote: He who draws noble delights from sentiments of poetry is a true poet, though he has never written a line in all his life.
data.author: George Sand

data.quote: A poem is never finished, only abandoned.
data.author: Paul Valery

data.quote: I have been enlightened. I have fallen into poetry and it has swallowed me up.
data.author: Keith Haring

data.quote: The drama is complete poetry. The ode and the epic contain it only in germ; it contains both of them in a state of high development, and epitomizes both.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: I consider myself a poet first and a musician second. I live like a poet and I'll die like a poet.
data.author: Bob Dylan

data.quote: Poetry is the opening and closing of a door, leaving those who look through to guess about what is seen during the moment.
data.author: Carl Sandburg

data.quote: I have nothing to say, I am saying it, and that is poetry.
data.author: John Cage

data.quote: The poet may be used as a barometer, but let us not forget that he is also part of the weather.
data.author: Lionel Trilling

data.quote: Breathe-in experience, breathe-out poetry.
data.author: Muriel Rukeyser

data.quote: To read a poem is to hear it with our eyes to hear it is to see it with our ears.
data.author: Octavio Paz

data.quote: Poetry is a mirror which makes beautiful that which is distorted.
data.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

data.quote: God is the perfect poet.
data.author: Robert Browning

data.quote: One will never again look at a birch tree, after the Robert Frost poem, in exactly the same way.
data.author: Paul Muldoon

data.quote: I still read Donne, particularly his love poems.
data.author: Carol Ann Duffy

data.quote: As human beings, we are the only organisms that create for the sheer stupid pleasure of doing so. Whether it's laying out a garden, composing a new tune on the piano, writing a bit of poetry, manipulating a digital photo, redecorating a room, or inventing a new chili recipe - we are happiest when we are creating.
data.author: Gary Hamel

data.quote: The genesis of a poem for me is usually a cluster of words. The only good metaphor I can think of is a scientific one: dipping a thread into a supersaturated solution to induce crystal formation. I don't think I solve problems in my poetry I think I uncover the problems.
data.author: Margaret Atwood

data.quote: I've written some poetry I don't understand myself.
data.author: Carl Sandburg

data.quote: Poetry is a sword of lightning, ever unsheathed, which consumes the scabbard that would contain it.
data.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

data.quote: Drawing is a way of coming upon the connection between things, just like metaphor in poetry reconnects what has become separated.
data.author: John Berger

data.quote: Poetry begins where language starts: in the shadows and accidents of one person's life.
data.author: Eavan Boland

data.quote: I have been writing poetry for a long time now. I started writing in my school days.
data.author: Kapil Sibal

data.quote: The true spirit of delight, the exaltation, the sense of being more than Man, which is the touchstone of the highest excellence, is to be found in mathematics as surely as poetry.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: Great poetry is always written by somebody straining to go beyond what he can do.
data.author: Stephen Spender

data.quote: Most people read poetry listening for echoes because the echoes are familiar to them. They wade through it the way a boy wades through water, feeling with his toes for the bottom: The echoes are the bottom.
data.author: Wallace Stevens

data.quote: Poetry should help, not only to refine the language of the time, but to prevent it from changing too rapidly.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: The only thing that can save the world is the reclaiming of the awareness of the world. That's what poetry does.
data.author: Allen Ginsberg

data.quote: Poetry is not an expression of the party line. It's that time of night, lying in bed, thinking what you really think, making the private world public, that's what the poet does.
data.author: Allen Ginsberg

data.quote: We make out of the quarrel with others, rhetoric, but of the quarrel with ourselves, poetry.
data.author: William Butler Yeats

data.quote: I don't think you get to good writing unless you expose yourself and your feelings. Deep songs don't come from the surface; they come from the deep down. The poetry and the songs that you are suppose to write, I believe are in your heart.
data.author: Judy Collins

data.quote: Theater and poetry were what helped people stay alive and want to go on living.
data.author: Vanessa Redgrave

data.quote: Poetry involves the mysteries of the irrational perceived through rational words.
data.author: Vladimir Nabokov

data.quote: In poetry, you must love the words, the ideas and the images and rhythms with all your capacity to love anything at all.
data.author: Wallace Stevens

data.quote: That's the way it is with poetry: When it is incomprehensible it seems profound, and when you understand it, it is only ridiculous.
data.author: Galway Kinnell

data.quote: Poetry is as precise a thing as geometry.
data.author: Gustave Flaubert

data.quote: I'm sorry, man, but I've got magic. I've got poetry in my fingertips. Most of the time - and this includes naps - I'm an F-18, bro. And I will destroy you in the air. I will deploy my ordinance to the ground.
data.author: Charlie Sheen

data.quote: In the language of poetry, where every word is weighed, nothing is usual or normal. Not a single stone and not a single cloud above it. Not a single day and not a single night after it. And above all, not a single existence, not anyone's existence in this world.
data.author: Wislawa Szymborska

data.quote: You know, people speak in poetry all the time. They just don't realize it.
data.author: Sherman Alexie

data.quote: I don't think I've ever read poetry, ever.
data.author: Eminem

data.quote: I have piles of poetry books in the bathroom, on the stairs, everywhere. The only way to write poetry is to read it.
data.author: Carol Ann Duffy

data.quote: If you don't mark your successes, the day your ship comes in could be just another day at the office, and there's no poetry in that.
data.author: Glen Hansard

data.quote: It is certain that at certain times talent entirely overcomes thought or poetry.
data.author: John Singer Sargent

data.quote: If you've ever been to a poetry slam, you know that the highest scoring emotion is self-righteous indignation: how dare you judge me. So in that way, the poem, 'What Teachers Make,' is an absolutely formulaic slam poem designed to allow me to get up on my soap box and say, 'Let me tell you what really makes me angry.'
data.author: Taylor Mali

data.quote: When I rap, I get to express myself in a way where putting words together is like poetry, and sometimes it's better to talk in certain expressions than sing, you know? So I love, I love to rhyme when I want to express certain things.
data.author: Wyclef Jean

data.quote: I don't think I've ever read poetry, ever. I'm not really book-smart.
data.author: Eminem

data.quote: I think it's often assumed that the role of poetry is to comfort, but for me, poetry is the great unsettler. It questions the established order of the mind. It is radical, by which I don't mean that it is either leftwing or rightwing, but that it works at the roots of thinking.
data.author: Alice Oswald

data.quote: If poetry and the arts do anything, they can fortify your inner life, your inwardness.
data.author: Seamus Heaney

data.quote: Everybody interprets things differently with their own perception, and I want poetry to pull out of them their own feelings.
data.author: John Trudell

data.quote: Poetry, at its best, is the language your soul would speak if you could teach your soul to speak.
data.author: Jim Harrison

data.quote: I'm reading a lot of poetry because it's a lot easier to dip in and dip out when you've got 10 minutes to yourself.
data.author: Hozier

data.quote: Music has a poetry of its own, and that poetry is called melody.
data.author: Joshua Logan

data.quote: People wish to be poets more than they wish to write poetry, and that's a mistake. One should wish to celebrate more than one wishes to be celebrated.
data.author: Lucille Clifton

data.quote: If there's no money in poetry, neither is there poetry in money.
data.author: Robert Graves

data.quote: I guess I wanted to leave America for awhile. It wasn't that I wanted to become an expatriate, or just never come back, I needed some breathing room. I'd already been translating French poetry, I'd been to Paris once before and liked it very much, and so I just went.
data.author: Paul Auster

data.quote: The music just tends to be a vehicle for that poetry.
data.author: Mark Knopfler

data.quote: Literature is a state of culture, poetry is a state of grace, before and after culture.
data.author: Juan Ramon Jimenez

data.quote: I think the first time I really heard poetry was in the schoolyard. Just the little limericks that kids say when they're jumping rope and playing games. I think that's the first time I heard rhyming words - I don't know if I'd call that the definitive poetry, but that's when I heard rhyming words said and not necessarily sung.
data.author: Jill Scott

data.quote: What are the sources of poetry? Love and death and the paradox of love and death. All poetry from the beginning is about Eros and Thanatos. Those are the only subjects. And how Eros and Thanatos interweave.
data.author: Erica Jong

data.quote: More modern poetry is written than read.
data.author: P. J. O'Rourke

data.quote: Poetry at its best can do you a lot of harm.
data.author: Sylvia Plath

data.quote: Jazz and poetry both involve a structure that may be familiar and to some extent predictable. And then, you try to create as much surprise and spontaneity and feeling and variation while respecting that structure.
data.author: Robert Pinsky

data.quote: I was raised on songs of poetry like Simon and Garfunkel and Cat Stevens and Neil Young, etc. I love those old songs probably the most because they hit me so deep down in my core.
data.author: Jessica Steen

data.quote: When you write, it's just a much more crystalline, compressed version of the voice you think with - though not the one you speak with. I think your writing voice is your laser-guided missile. It's the poetry part of you.
data.author: Douglas Coupland

data.quote: Maya Angelou was the voice of three generations. Her poetry spanned our journey, chronicled our hearts and documented our struggles as we moved from the orations of Martin Luther King to the presidency of Barack Obama.
data.author: Donna Brazile

data.quote: Poetry is the universal language which the heart holds with nature and itself. He who has a contempt for poetry, cannot have much respect for himself, or for anything else.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: In the television age, the key distinction is between the candidate who can speak poetry and the one who can only speak prose.
data.author: Richard M. Nixon

data.quote: I recently read that it's the left brain that does all that calculating, and the right brain that does the poetry. Somehow I've veered way towards the left. I've been doing it for years. Maybe I do art to balance it out.
data.author: Jason Mraz

data.quote: When I was 18, I took a trip to Thailand with a friend. We stayed for a month. Bangkok was very raw for a teenager: there were no cellphones, no Internet, and the only music I had with me was this cassette by Liz Phair. I was writing a lot of poetry, and she embodied a talky style of songwriting that I found very accessible.
data.author: Jenny Lewis

data.quote: In a way, Anglo-Saxon poetry cannot be translated.
data.author: Seamus Heaney

data.quote: No poetry that I'm aware of, however bad or glorious, has ever left somebody a worse person than they were before they read it.
data.author: Felix Dennis

data.quote: What my character is or how many jails I have lounged in, or wards or walls or wassails, how many lonely-heart poetry readings I have dodged, is beside the point. A man's soul or lack of it will be evident with what he can carve upon a white sheet of paper.
data.author: Charles Bukowski

data.quote: If the object of poetry is, to make men, then poetry is the heir of prophecy.
data.author: Muhammad Iqbal

data.quote: Living here on Earth, we breathe the rhythms of a universe that extends infinitely above us. When resonant harmonies arise between this vast outer cosmos and the inner human cosmos, poetry is born.
data.author: Daisaku Ikeda

data.quote: But I liked Yeats! That wild Irishman. I really loved his love of language, his flow. His chaotic ideas seemed to me just the right thing for a poet. Passion! He was always on the right side. He may be wrongheaded, but his heart was always on the right side. He wrote beautiful poetry.
data.author: Chinua Achebe

data.quote: Alchemy is the art of far and near, and I think poetry is alchemy in that way. It's delightful to distort size, to see something that's tiny as though it were vast.
data.author: Robert Morgan

data.quote: Poetry is not only a set of words which are chosen to relate to each other it is something which goes much further than that to provide a glimpse of our vision of the world.
data.author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

data.quote: Shakespeare was a man who wrote poetry. I'm a man who writes poetry. Why not compare yourself to the best?
data.author: Jay-Z

data.quote: Poetry fettered, fetters the human race. Nations are destroyed or flourish in proportion as their poetry, painting, and music are destroyed or flourish.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: It is time to get drunk! So as not to be the martyred slaves of Time, get drunk; get drunk without stopping! On wine, on poetry, or on virtue, as you wish.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.quote: I've written poetry since I was in the first grade, and it wasn't until I was a little bit older that I realized poetry could be put to music and become a song.
data.author: Jordin Sparks

data.quote: I am two fools, I know, for loving, and for saying so in whining poetry.
data.author: John Donne

data.quote: I saw the gooseflesh on my skin. I did not know what made it. I was not cold. Had a ghost passed over? No, it was the poetry.
data.author: Sylvia Plath

data.quote: How can any one paint who cannot grade colors? How can any one write poetry who has not learnt to hear and see?
data.author: Maria Montessori

data.quote: Naming a baby is an act of poetry, for many people the only creative moment of their lives.
data.author: Richard Eyre

data.quote: All slang is metaphor, and all metaphor is poetry.
data.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

data.quote: In the total darkness, poetry is still there, and it is there for you.
data.author: Abbas Kiarostami

data.quote: If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can ever warm me, I know that is poetry.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: Everything one invents is true, you may be perfectly sure of that. Poetry is as precise as geometry.
data.author: Gustave Flaubert

data.quote: Poetry should surprise by a fine excess and not by singularity, it should strike the reader as a wording of his own highest thoughts, and appear almost a remembrance.
data.author: John Keats

data.quote: The reason why we do maths is because it's like poetry. It's about patterns, and that really turned me on. It made me feel that maths was in tune with the other things I liked doing.
data.author: Marcus du Sautoy

data.quote: Let's detox our cluttered academic brain. That's what the poet does. People call it daydreaming, detoxing our minds and taking care of that clutter. It's being able to let in call letters from the poetry universe.
data.author: Juan Felipe Herrera

data.quote: A poet must be a psychologist, but a secret one: he should know and feel the roots of phenomena but present only the phenomena themselves in full bloom or as they fade away.
data.author: Ivan Turgenev

data.quote: The poetry you read has been written for you, each of you - black, white, Hispanic, man, woman, gay, straight.
data.author: Maya Angelou

data.quote: Poetry comes alive to me through recitation.
data.author: Natalie Merchant

data.quote: A theology should be like poetry, which takes us to the end of what words and thoughts can do.
data.author: Karen Armstrong

data.quote: Poetry carries its history within it, and it is oral in origin. Its transmission was oral.
data.author: James Fenton

data.quote: I am an artist, you understand? For me, a picture is like poetry. When you make art, this is not coming from an intellectual place. It's coming from the deep side of your unconscious, your soul.
data.author: Alejandro Jodorowsky

data.quote: Wanted: a needle swift enough to sew this poem into a blanket.
data.author: Charles Simic

data.quote: I do not see how a man can work on the frontiers of physics and write poetry at the same time. They are in opposition.
data.author: Paul Dirac

data.quote: The thing about great poetry is we have no defenses against it.
data.author: David Whyte

data.quote: I think the poetry that came out of Belfast, and especially the Queen's University set, in the 1970s and '80s - you know, Paul Muldoon and Seamus Heaney, Derek Mahon and Ciaran Carson - that was probably the finest body of work since the Gaelic renaissance, up there with the work of Yeats and Synge and Lady Gregory.
data.author: Adrian McKinty

data.quote: I'm not really a musician. I'm a performer, and I love rock n' roll. I've embraced rock n' roll because it encompasses all the things I'm interested in: poetry, revolution, sexuality, political activism - all of these things can be found in rock n' roll.
data.author: Patti Smith

data.quote: I wish our clever young poets would remember my homely definitions of prose and poetry; that is, prose = words in their best order; - poetry = the best words in the best order.
data.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

data.quote: The poetry of a people comes from the deep recesses of the unconscious, the irrational and the collective body of our ancestral memories.
data.author: Margaret Walker

data.quote: Bleak House is just the most astounding piece of work. There's huge, visionary poetry in it.
data.author: Simon Callow

data.quote: Have you ever heard a good joke? If you've ever heard someone just right, with the right pacing, then you're already on the way to poetry. It's about using words in very precise ways and using gesture.
data.author: Rita Dove

data.quote: I love Sufism as I love beautiful poetry, but it is not the answer. Sufism is like a mirage in the desert. It says to you, come and sit, relax and enjoy yourself for a while.
data.author: Naguib Mahfouz

data.quote: Poetry is the record of the best and happiest moments of the happiest and best minds.
data.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

data.quote: Written poetry is worth reading once, and then should be destroyed. Let the dead poets make way for others.
data.author: Antonin Artaud

data.quote: Poetry isn't a profession, it's a way of life. It's an empty basket; you put your life into it and make something out of that.
data.author: Mary Oliver

data.quote: It's not easy to define poetry.
data.author: Bob Dylan

data.quote: I don't like the word 'poetry,' and I don't like poetry readings, and I usually don't like poets. I would much prefer describing myself and what I do as: I'm kind of a curator, and I'm kind of a night-owl reporter.
data.author: Tom Waits

data.quote: I began writing early - very, very early... I was already writing short stories for the radio and selling poems to poetry and art festivals; I was involved in school plays; I wrote essays, so there was no definite moment when I said, 'Now I'm a writer.' I've always been a writer.
data.author: Wole Soyinka

data.quote: I've always written. There's a journal which I kept from about 9 years old. The man who gave it to me lived across the street from the store and kept it when my grandmother's papers were destroyed. I'd written some essays. I loved poetry, still do. But I really, really loved it then.
data.author: Maya Angelou

data.quote: For an American, there's no automatic place where people love the art of poetry. There's not a social class that considers poetry its property the way in some countries there's a snob value to the art.
data.author: Robert Pinsky

data.quote: If I have to make a self-portrait, I would put poetry and rebellion on the list. To be able to walk on a wire, to be able to juggle six hoops, you need focus, another word for tenacity, which is passion.
data.author: Philippe Petit

data.quote: The Victorian language of flowers began with the publication of 'Le Language des Fleurs,' written by Charlotte de Latour and printed in Paris in 1819. To create the book - which was a list of flowers and their meanings - de Latour gathered references to flower symbolism throughout poetry, ancient mythology, and even medicine.
data.author: Vanessa Diffenbaugh

data.quote: I have written some poetry and two prose books about baseball, but if I had been a rich man, I probably would not have written many of the magazine essays that I have had to do. But, needing to write magazine essays to support myself, I looked to things that I cared about and wanted to write about, and certainly baseball was one of them.
data.author: Donald Hall

data.quote: Poetry is one of the ancient arts, and it began as did all the fine arts, within the original wilderness of the earth.
data.author: Mary Oliver

data.quote: I came into music because I thought the presentation of poetry wasn't vibrant enough. So I merged improvised poetry with basic rock chords. That was my original mission.

data.quote: Like most lit nerds, I'm a voracious reader. I never got enough poetry under my belt growing up but I do read it - some of my favorites, Gina Franco and Angela Shaw and Cornelius Eady and Kevin Young, remind me daily that unless the words sing and dance, what's the use of putting them down on paper.

data.quote: Each word bears its weight, so you have to read my poems quite slowly.
data.author: Anne Stevenson

data.quote: Superstition is the poetry of life.
data.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

data.quote: I started off in England and very few people knew I was Australian. I mean, the clues were in the poems, but they didn't read them very carefully, and so for years and years I was considered completely part of the English poetry scene.

data.quote: The Bible is not just one book, but an entire library, with stories, songs, poetry, letters and history, as well as literature that might more obviously qualify as 'religious.'

data.quote: Human beings love poetry. They don't even know it sometimes... whether they're the songs of Bono, or the songs of Justin Bieber... they're listening to poetry.
data.author: Maya Angelou

data.quote: If the poetry world celebrate its female stars at the true level of their productivity and influence, poetry would wind up being a largely female world, and the men would leave.
data.author: Eileen Myles

data.quote: The moment of change is the only poem.
data.author: Adrienne Rich

data.quote: 'Therefore' is a word the poet must not know.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: Any healthy man can go without food for two days - but not without poetry.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.quote: Poetry is the art of creating imaginary gardens with real toads.
data.author: Marianne Moore

data.quote: A poet can survive everything but a misprint.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: All bad poetry springs from genuine feeling.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: Poetry is ordinary language raised to the Nth power. Poetry is boned with ideas, nerved and blooded with emotions, all held together by the delicate, tough skin of words.
data.author: Paul Engle

data.quote: The crown of literature is poetry.
data.author: W. Somerset Maugham

data.quote: A poet looks at the world the way a man looks at a woman.
data.author: Wallace Stevens

data.quote: A poem might be defined as thinking about feelings - about human feelings and frailties.
data.author: Anne Stevenson

data.quote: He could not die when trees were green, for he loved the time too well.
data.author: John Clare

data.quote: There may be more poetry than justice in poetic justice.
data.author: George Will

data.quote: There are men who can write poetry, and there are men who can read balance sheets. The men who can read balance sheets cannot write.
data.author: Henry R. Luce

data.quote: Poetry is all nouns and verbs.
data.author: Marianne Moore

data.quote: The blood jet is poetry and there is no stopping it.
data.author: Sylvia Plath

data.quote: I think that the job of poetry, its political job, is to refresh the idea of justice, which is going dead in us all the time.
data.author: Robert Hass

data.quote: Poetry is a sort of homecoming.
data.author: Paul Celan

data.quote: I didn't want to deal in poetry. I got rid of that after a few months.
data.author: Tom Wesselmann

data.quote: Of course a poem is a two-way street. No poem is any good if it doesn't suggest to the reader things from his own mind and recollection that he will read into it, and will add to what the poet has suggested. But I do think poetry readings are very important.

data.quote: Pound's translation of Chinese poetry was maybe the most important thing I read. Eliot a little bit later.
data.author: Robert Morgan

data.quote: A group of us started a community center in Santa Monica. We've tried different programs, and three have worked really well. A poetry group. Once a week we visit Venice High and talk to girls at risk.

data.quote: Slowly poetry becomes visual because it paints images, but it is also musical: it unites two arts into one.
data.author: Eugenio Montale

data.quote: What we know is that Shakespeare wrote perhaps the most remarkable body of passionate love poetry in the English language to a young man.
data.author: Stephen Greenblatt

data.quote: So, poetry becomes a means for useful dialogue between people who are not only unknown, but mute to each other. It produces a dialogue among people that guards all of us against manipulation by our so-called leaders.
data.author: June Jordan

data.quote: Writing poetry makes you intensely conscious of how words sound, both aloud and inside the head of the reader. You learn the weight of words and how they sound to the ear.

data.author: James Dickey

data.quote: Why should poetry have to make sense?
data.author: Charlie Chaplin

data.author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

data.quote: Yet, it is true, poetry is delicious; the best prose is that which is most full of poetry.
data.author: Virginia Woolf

data.quote: The musician is perhaps the most modest of animals, but he is also the proudest. It is he who invented the sublime art of ruining poetry.

data.quote: I see people who talk about America, and then undermine it by not paying attention to its soul, to its poetry. I see polarization, reductionism and superficiality.

data.quote: I always wrote poetry and stuff like that, so putting songs together wasn't that spectacular.
data.author: Amy Winehouse

data.quote: When I hit a block, regardless of what I am writing, what the subject matter is, or what's going on in the plot, I go back and I read Pablo Neruda's poetry. data.quote: The middle class is doing fine in fiction. But it's not what gets me going. I love the working class, and everyone from it I've met, and think they're incredibly witty, inventive - there's a lot of poetry there.
data.author: Martin Amis

data.quote: I read poetry to save time.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe

data.quote: The poetry and transgression that was so much of surrealism's anarchic force has been recruited into mainstream culture. It has been made commonplace by television and magazine merchandising, by computer games and Internet visuals, by film and MTV, by the fashion shoot.

data.quote: Poetry, for me, is the answer to, 'How does one stay sane when private lives are being ransacked by public events?' It's something that hangs over your head all the time.

data.author: Billy Collins

data.quote: I think of something quite different from a snapshot. I know of a lot of poems, some very fine ones, that are like snapshots, but I'm more interested in poetry that is like an endless film, long stories, things that weave together many different strands, like a big piece of cloth, not like a photograph.
data.author: Robert Bringhurst

data.quote: As far as I am concerned, poetry is a statement concerning the human condition, composed in verse.
data.author: N. Scott Momaday

data.quote: My father loved poetry and music. But deep in himself he thought teaching the finest thing a person could do.
data.author: George Steiner

data.quote: One night, I lay awake for hours, just terrified. When the dawn finally came up - the comfortable blue sky, the familiar world returning - I could think of no other way to express my relief than through poetry. I made a decision there and then that it was what I wanted to do. Every time I pulled a wishbone, it was what I asked for.
data.author: Alice Oswald

data.quote: Poetry, fiction as novels or short stories - these are autonomous as created by their authors. They should stand on their own, like pieces of furniture that should be judged as to their usefulness, elegance.

data.quote: I am for poetry that is admired by peasant and aristocrat alike.
data.author: F. Sionil Jose

data.quote: For me, I used to be shy towards journalism because it wasn't poetry. And then I realized that the events that I covered in essays that became journalism were actually great because they inspired me, and they became my muse.

data.quote: In Northern Ireland, helicopters are not usually used to promote poetry.
data.author: Seamus Heaney

data.quote: I admire 'Adventure Time' for being a piece of art in the way that I think art should be. If you want to see it is poetry, you can, and if you don't, you can watch a fun cartoon.

data.quote: When I was young, I read everything I could lay my hands on, but the Scots in my storybooks spent their time fighting glorious battles, rowing across lochs, or escaping over moors of purple heather. data.quote: Surrealism is not a poetry but a poetics, and even more, and more decisively, a world vision.
data.author: Octavio Paz

data.quote: Many great works of art, poetry, and music are inspired by astral memories. The desire to do noble, beautiful things here on Earth is also often a carryover of astral experiences between a person's earth lives.

data.quote: I owe my discovery of the Hot Club of Cowtown to Kinky Friedman, leader of the Texas Jewboys. data.author: Clive Sinclair

data.quote: I like cups of tea and reading books and poetry and old people things.
data.author: Bindi Irwin

data.quote: Poetry is a call to action, and it also is action.
data.author: Juan Felipe Herrera

data.quote: The muse, the beloved, and duende are three ways of thinking of what is the source of poetry, and all three seem to me different names or different ways to think about something that is not entirely reasonable, not entirely subject to the will, not entirely rational.

data.quote: In poetry, I have, since very young, loved poetry in translation. The Chinese, the French, the Russians, Italians, Indians and early Celts: the formality of the translator's voice, their measured breath and anxiety moves me as it lingers over the original.
data.author: Fanny Howe

data.quote: There is a gap in my work from '84 to 2002, 18 years where I stopped writing. I was working at fiction and other things and starting a school and getting married and starting a family, but I wasn't writing poetry for the better part of 15 years.

data.quote: The major poets of New Jersey have all suffered, whether it's Whitman, who lost his job for 'Leaves of Grass,' or William Carlos Williams, who was called a communist, or Ginsberg, whose 'Howl' was prosecuted, or myself. data.author: Amiri Baraka

data.quote: I do believe that we've a responsibility to try to acknowledge the range, both geographic and graphic, of what's happening in poetry in English. I'm interested in poems that are first-rate. After that, I'm not too concerned if they come from Queens or Queensland.

data.quote: When I get depressed, I try to get something for the terrible sadness that comes over me and create something in terms of poetry.

data.quote: The topics just kind of come to me. If they are relevant, it's because they're happening in the world around me, and it's affecting me. Poetry is my way of dealing with it.

data.quote: There is no Frigate like a book to take us lands away nor any coursers like a page of prancing Poetry.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: Money is a kind of poetry.
data.author: Wallace Stevens

data.quote: Music begins to atrophy when it departs too far from the dance... poetry begins to atrophy when it gets too far from music.
data.author: Ezra Pound

data.quote: The Bible should be taught, but emphatically not as reality. It is fiction, myth, poetry, anything but reality. As such it needs to be taught because it underlies so much of our literature and our culture.

data.quote: Verse in itself does not constitute poetry. Verse is only an elegant vestment for a beautiful form. data.quote: I want to promote poetry to the point where you got all the baldhead kids running around doing poetry, getting the music out of the way and having only words, the spoken word, and then see what happens.

data.quote: Anybody serious about poetry knows how hard it is to achieve anything worthwhile in it.
data.author: Seamus Heaney

data.quote: Often people, when they're confronted with a poem, it's like someone who keep saying 'what is the meaning of this? What is the meaning of this?' And that dulls us to the other pleasures poetry offers.

data.quote: Radio is such a perfect medium for the transmission of poetry, primarily because there just is the voice, there's no visual distraction.

data.quote: Making poetry with a camera - that's the essence of what I do.

data.quote: Poetry can tell us about what's going on in our lives - not only our personal but our social and political lives.

data.quote: Good poets have written in order to describe something or to preach something - with their eye on the object or the end. The essence of the poetry does not lie in the thing described or in the message imparted but in the resulting concrete unity, the poem.

data.quote: I liked to write from the time I was about 12 or 13. I loved to read. And since I only spoke to my brother, I would write down my thoughts. data.quote: I wrote some of the worst poetry west from the Mississippi River, but I wrote. And I finally sometimes got it right.

data.quote: I'm happy to be a writer - of prose, poetry, every kind of writing. Every person in the world who isn't a recluse, hermit or mute uses words. I know of no other art form that we always use.

data.quote: It could be that all awful dictators are frustrated artists - Mao with his poetry and Mussolini with his monuments. data.quote: I felt like my favorite writers have almost musical hooks in their work, whether it's poetry or a hook at the end of a chapter that makes you want to read the next one. data.quote: What I wanted to do in rock 'n roll was merge poetry with sonic scapes, and the two people who had contributed so much to that were Jimi Hendrix and Jim Morrison.

data.quote: When I was younger, I felt it was my duty to wake people up. I thought poetry was asleep. I thought rock 'n' roll was asleep.

data.quote: I didn't love Jim Morrison 'cause he was self-destructive. I loved him because of his work. Because of the way he merged poetry and rock-and-roll. Because he did something new.

data.quote: Rhyme, that enslaved queen, that supreme charm of our poetry, that creator of our meter.

data.quote: Writing criticism is to writing fiction and poetry as hugging the shore is to sailing in the open sea.

data.quote: I must say, when I reread myself, it's the poetry I tend to look at. It's the most exciting to write, and it's over the quickest.

data.quote: As an actor, there is room for a certain amount of creativity, but you're always ultimately going to be saying somebody else's words. I don't think I'd have the stamina, skill or ability to write a novel, but I'd love to write short stories and poetry, because those are my two passions.

data.quote: I don't think I'd have the stamina, skill or ability to write a novel, but I'd love to write short stories and poetry, because those are my two passions.
data.author: Daniel Radcliffe

data.quote: On a practical level, poetry isn't something anybody has really made a great living at. I might sell some books and, once in a while, someone might pay to hear me read.

data.quote: Photography, painting or poetry - those are just extensions of me, how I perceive things; they are my way of communicating.

data.quote: I have a publishing company of books by me and books of others. It drew people to poetry readings and photo exhibitions and painting exhibitions that I've been doing for years before that.

data.quote: I've been reading poetry publicly for 20 years, and this is what you do - you express, you sometimes dig a bit to get a conversation started. That's the point of poetry. You're supposed to go, 'Hmmmm,' and 'Woooh!'

data.author: Jill Scott

data.quote: The claims I'm making for art are simply the claims that we naturally make around music or around poetry. We're much more relaxed around those art forms. We're willing to ask, 'How could this find a place in my heart?'

data.quote: Existential philosophy, poetry and art - just like sadness - were all unavoidable to a tender young man in the meat works.

data.quote: When I am writing fiction, I believe I am much better organized, more methodical - one has to be when writing a novel. Writing poetry is a state of free float.

data.author: Margaret Atwood

data.quote: Americans have been tremendously fortunate in poetry, regarding both the quantity and quality of poetry produced. Unfortunately, it remains in schools and universities; it is not widely distributed.
data.author: Joseph Brodsky

data.quote: Poetry is rather an approach to things, to life, than it is typographical production.
data.author: Joseph Brodsky

data.quote: Poetry seems to be the only weapon able to beat language, using language's own means.
data.author: Joseph Brodsky

data.quote: To translate poetry, one has to possess some art, at the very least the art of stylistic re-embodiment.
data.author: Joseph Brodsky

data.quote: The more one reads poetry, the less tolerant one becomes of any sort of verbosity, be that in political or philosophical discourse, be that in history, social studies or the art of fiction.
data.author: Joseph Brodsky

data.quote: My idea is simply - is very simple - is that the books of poetry should be published in far greater volume and be distributed in far greater volume, in far more substantial manner. You can sell in supermarkets very cheaply. In paperbacks. You can sell in drugstores.
data.author: Joseph Brodsky

data.quote: This assumption that the blue collar crowd is not supposed to read it, or a farmer in his overalls is not to read poetry, seems to be dangerous if not tragic.
data.author: Joseph Brodsky

data.quote: I am a patriot, but I must say that English poetry is the richest in the world.
data.author: Joseph Brodsky

data.quote: Poetry is not an art or a branch of art: it's something more.
data.author: Joseph Brodsky

data.quote: Anyone who regards poetry as an entertainment, as a 'read,' commits an anthropological crime, in the first place against himself.
data.author: Joseph Brodsky

data.quote: American poetry to me is a sort of relentless, nonstop sermon on human autonomy.
data.author: Joseph Brodsky

data.quote: Tyranny will make an entire population into readers of poetry.
data.author: Joseph Brodsky

data.quote: American poetry is this country's greatest patrimony. It takes a stranger to see some things clearly. This is one of them, and I am that stranger.
data.author: Joseph Brodsky

data.quote: Poetry isn't just different from prose, it's more important for the human species.
data.author: Joseph Brodsky

data.quote: The charge frequently leveled against poetry - that it is difficult, obscure, hermetic and whatnot - indicates not the state of poetry but, frankly, the rung of the evolutionary ladder on which society is stuck.
data.author: Joseph Brodsky

data.quote: People who buy 'The National Enquirer' would buy poetry. They should be given a choice. I'm absolutely serious.
data.author: Joseph Brodsky

data.quote: People compose poetry, novels, sitcoms - for love.
data.author: Helen Fisher

data.quote: Being able to say something lyrically, to say something that will do more than just be words, is really hard. It's easy to do when you're writing a chapter of a book or writing poetry, but it's really hard to do when you're confined to a melody line.

data.quote: That metre itself forms an essential part of all true poetry is a principle which not even the assertions of an Aristotle or the pronouncements of a Plato can disestablish.

data.quote: When you are writing literary writing, you are communicating something subtextual with emotions and poetry. The prose has to have a voice; it's not just typing. It takes a while to get that voice.
data.author: Joyce Carol Oates

data.quote: I'm moved by people who see the world differently than others. People who see the world with a longing for its poetry often can be broken people.
data.author: Laura Dern

data.quote: For awhile after you quit Keats all other poetry seems to be only whistling or humming.
data.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

data.quote: What is beautiful enchants me. I mean not just physical beauty but a wider concept of beauty. There is beauty in poetry and in great musical or singing performances. There is beauty everywhere if you can just see it.

data.quote: Personally I always feel like I could use a little more of poetry apothegmatic power in my own work but we're always lacking something.

data.quote: I didn't start writing songs, honestly, until I started making my album. I was always doing poetry, but I never thought I could write songs. data.quote: In much of computer science, I can easily 'auto-grade' your work and give you an instant meaningful feedback. I can't do this when it comes to the subtlety of human thought, language, poetry, philosophy.

data.quote: I want to branch out. I want to write. I write poetry. I want to see my children grow up well.
data.author: Annie Lennox

data.quote: Poetry is all that is worth remembering in life.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Shakespeare is rhythmic; he is musical in the sense that he likes poetry, and he's musical because he constantly refers to settings where there's singing and dancing.

data.quote: Maybe it is something to do with age, but I have become fonder of poetry than of prose.

data.quote: I love reading poetry, and yet, at this point, the thought of writing a poem, to me, is tantamount to figuring out a trigonometry question.

data.quote: Lyric poetry is, of course, musical in origin. I do know that what happened to poetry in the twentieth century was that it began to be written for the page. data.quote: English poetry begins whenever we decide to say the modern English language begins, and it extends as far as we decide to say that the English language extends.
data.author: James Fenton

data.quote: Some people think that English poetry begins with the Anglo-Saxons. And anyway, Anglo-Saxon is a different language, which has to be learned.
data.author: James Fenton

data.quote: When we study Shakespeare on the page, for academic purposes, we may require all kinds of help. Generally, we read him in modern spelling and with modern punctuation, and with notes. data.quote: Composers need words, but they do not necessarily need poetry. The Russian composer, Aleksandr Mossolov, who chose texts from newspaper small ads, had a good point to make. With revolutionary music, any text can be set to work.

data.quote: A glance at the history of European poetry is enough to inform us that rhyme itself is not indispensable. data.quote: Great poetry does not have to be technically intricate.

data.quote: The iambic pentameter owes its pre-eminence in English poetry to its genius for variation. Good blank verse does not sound like a series of identically measured lines. It sounds like a series of subtle variations on the same theme.

data.quote: One problem we face comes from the lack of any agreed sense of how we should be working to train ourselves to write poetry.

data.quote: In the writing of poetry we never know anything for sure. We will never know if we have 'trained' or 'practised' enough. We will never be able to say that we have reached grade eight, or that we have left the grades behind and are now embarked on an advanced training.

data.quote: Poetry always, always, always is a key piece of democracy.
data.author: Eileen Myles

data.quote: As things get worse, poetry gets better because it becomes more necessary.
data.author: Eileen Myles

data.quote: I wasn't afraid of being poor. I didn't want to live in a big house. I'm the perfect size for poetry. I can move around.
data.author: Eileen Myles

data.quote: In Arlington, people would laugh at you if you tried to get people to look at your drawings or listen to your poetry. It was like you thought you were special.
data.author: Eileen Myles

data.quote: Poetry from the bottom up is an act of selection: you kind of feel your way through the crowds of poems. The good ones came forward a long time ago, and the bad ones fell away.
data.author: Eileen Myles

data.quote: Poetry and novels are lists of our devotions. We love the feel of making the marks as the feelings are rising and falling.
data.author: Eileen Myles

data.quote: Prose, poetry, and drawings stand side by side in a very democratic way in my work.
data.author: Gunter Grass

data.quote: I'd park myself in the bookstore and read with one eye on everyone coming in. I remember reading a Robert Bly book of poetry.
data.author: Sally Mann

data.quote: I lived a pretty chaotic life. I went to England, and I moved around, and there were a lot of things that I was interested in. I wrote poetry. I took photographs. I was a musician and all sorts of things. Nothing brilliant, but I did all these different things.
data.author: Pawel Pawlikowski

data.quote: Watching and learning from the great Josette Bushell-Mingo, who was playing Cleopatra in Antony and Cleopatra at the time, and then to return to the same stage six months later playing a lead role, was incredible - I fell in love with the poetry and the breadth of the language so much that I didn't want it to end.
data.author: Gugu Mbatha-Raw

data.quote: I never thought I'd be doing poetry books. I never really studied poetry. But the first one I did was after my mother died, and I realized that people sort of think and talk about her style and fashion, but in fact, what made her the person she was was really her love of reading and ideas.
data.author: Caroline Kennedy

data.quote: Poetry is really a way of sharing feelings and ideas.
data.author: Caroline Kennedy

data.quote: The biggest problem is people are afraid of poetry, think they can't understand it or that it will be boring.
data.author: Caroline Kennedy

data.quote: The mystical poetry of William Blake's artwork also forms the basis for the album cover.
data.author: Bruce Dickinson

data.quote: Perhaps no person can be a poet, or even enjoy poetry, without a certain unsoundness of mind.
data.author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

data.quote: As civilization advances, poetry almost necessarily declines.
data.author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

data.quote: I liked Yeats! That wild Irishman. I really loved his love of language, his flow. His chaotic ideas seemed to me just the right thing for a poet. Passion! He was always on the right side. He may be wrongheaded, but his heart was always on the right side. He wrote beautiful poetry.
data.author: Chinua Achebe

data.quote: I was trained as an actress. But I wasn't a very convincing actress, so I started doing punk poetry and then fell into doing stand-up.
data.author: Jenny Eclair

data.quote: When I was in college, I wrote poetry very seriously, and then once I had started writing short stories, I didn't go back to poetry, partially because I felt like I understood how incredibly difficult it was.
data.author: Elizabeth McCracken

data.quote: Poetry is often the art of overhearing yourself say things you didn't know you knew. It is a learned skill to force yourself to articulate your life, your present world or your possibilities for the future.
data.author: David Whyte

data.quote: There's a fierce practicality and empiricism which the whole imaginative, lyrical aspect of poetry comes from.
data.author: David Whyte

data.quote: Poetry is a street fighter. It has sharp elbows. It can look after itself. Poetry can't be used for manipulation it's why you never see good poetry in advertising.
data.author: David Whyte

data.quote: By definition, poetry works with qualities and dynamics that mainstream society is reluctant to face head-on. It's an interesting phenomenon that by necessity, poetry is just below the radar.
data.author: David Whyte

data.quote: It is the province of poetry to be more realistic and present than the artificial narratives of an outer discourse, and not afraid of the truthful difficulty of the average human life.
data.author: David Whyte

data.quote: Poetry carries the imagery which is large enough for the kind of life we want for ourselves.
data.author: David Whyte

data.quote: Unfortunately, poetry is not born in noise, in crowds, or on a bus. There have to be four walls and the certainty that the telephone will not ring. That's what writing is all about.
data.author: Wislawa Szymborska

data.quote: Poetic talent doesn't operate in a vacuum. There is a spirit of Polish poetry.
data.author: Wislawa Szymborska

data.quote: Everyone needs solitude, especially a person who is used to thinking about what she experiences. Solitude is very important in my work as a mode of inspiration, but isolation is not good in this respect. I am not writing poetry about isolation.
data.author: Wislawa Szymborska

data.quote: Solitude is very important in my work as a mode of inspiration, but isolation is not good in this respect. I am not writing poetry about isolation.
data.author: Wislawa Szymborska

data.quote: Thomas Davis was a great man where poetry is concerned, and a better than Thomas Moore. All over Ireland his poetry is, and he would have done other things but that he died young.
data.author: Lady Gregory

data.quote: I'm not a great poetry fan.
data.author: Rupert Everett

data.quote: Colloquial poetry is to the real art as the barber's wax dummy is to sculpture.
data.author: Ezra Pound

data.quote: And New York is the most beautiful city in the world? It is not far from it. No urban night is like the night there... Squares after squares of flame, set up and cut into the aether. Here is our poetry, for we have pulled down the stars to our will.
data.author: Ezra Pound

data.quote: In my late teenage years, I developed a real passion for it, and wrote a lot of poetry.
data.author: Danielle Steel

data.quote: Reading a piece of poetry with no beat in front of 20 people is way more challenging than rocking for 10,000 people.
data.author: Macklemore

data.quote: I read, read enormously on all different fields of Islamic thought, from philosophy to Islamic literature, poetry, exegeses, knowledge of the Hadith, the teachings of the prophet. That's how I trained myself. And then I was appointed imam by a Sufi master from Istanbul, Turkey.
data.author: Feisal Abdul Rauf

data.quote: I think going from doing TV and straight plays to Shakespeare is weird enough because you have this heightened language, and you are telling a story through metric poetry. But I think music is that place beyond poetry.
data.author: Tamsin Greig

data.quote: Poetry always runs away from you - it's very difficult to grasp it, and every time you read it, depending on your conditions, you will have a different grasp of it. Whereas with a novel, once you have read it, you have grasped it.
data.author: Abbas Kiarostami

data.quote: My favourite room in my house is easily the top room, which is a bedroom but also a bathroom, with a big, wooden carved bath, two huge fireplaces and a raised bit in the corner for performances. I've had some really lovely parties and poetry readings up there.
data.author: Deborah Moggach

data.quote: I know I'm not a wordsmith. And I don't write poetry. Sometimes I think I should, because it's really helpful. But I always wanted to write novels.
data.author: Candace Bushnell

data.quote: I definitely used to write a lot at school. Comic poetry and drawings about people.
data.author: Sally Phillips

data.quote: Poetry is for me Eucharistic. You take someone else's suffering into your body, their passion comes into your body, and in doing that you commune, you take communion, you make a community with others.
data.author: Mary Karr

data.quote: Poetry privileges music and is aesthetically more challenging. Prose privileges information and is emotionally more challenging.
data.author: Mary Karr

data.quote: Prose cannot compete with the economy of poetry, the ability to have a full artistic experience in a short period of time.
data.author: Mary Karr

data.quote: Hebrew as a contemporary language, especially for poetry, is no longer the language of the Bible; but neither is it not the language of the Bible.
data.author: Cynthia Ozick

data.quote: I'm conscious of a series of circles working its way through my life. And at this particular moment I have come round to the beginning of my writing cycle. It begins with poetry. There's hardly a day that goes past on which I don't write poetry.
data.author: Ben Okri

data.quote: I began my writing life as a poet, so poetry has always been fundamental. I evolved from poetry to journalism to stories to novels. But poetry was always there.
data.author: Ben Okri

data.quote: I've been writing since I was 10 or 11. I started with poetry because that was the easiest thing. It just kind of came naturally. I think at that time West Coast hip hop was huge; all these kids around me were like, 'I want to be a rapper.' But I'm a white girl, not going to be a rapper.
data.author: Sasha Grey

data.quote: I've always loved the poetry in 'Pale Fire.' I think it's wonderful.
data.author: Jonathan Galassi

data.quote: Poetry is really about your mental state or intellectual, and where you are, and you're trying to evoke that, explain it to yourself, whatever, you're trying to dig into it, analyse yourself.
data.author: Jonathan Galassi

data.quote: I think poetry was always where I went to deal with my deepest feelings.
data.author: Jonathan Galassi

data.quote: I've always used poetry to explain myself to myself. These things just sat in my psyche and then came out.
data.author: Jonathan Galassi

data.quote: I love poetry; it's my primary literary interest, and I suppose the kind of reading you do when you are reading poems - close reading - can carry over into how you read other things.
data.author: Jonathan Galassi

data.quote: Poetry is not mainstream, but then neither is serious fiction, really. But I don't think there's a lot to worry about in this particular 'problem'. Why does art have to be mainstream to be significant?
data.author: Jonathan Galassi

data.quote: I think poetry should be read very much like prose, except that the line breaks should be acknowledged somehow.
data.author: Jonathan Galassi

data.quote: For me, poetry is a situation - a state of being, a way of facing life and facing history.
data.author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

data.quote: I came to poetry through the urgent need to denounce injustice, exploitation, humiliation. I know that's not enough to change the world. But to remain silent would have been a kind of intolerable complicity.
data.author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

data.quote: I love to read poetry but I haven't written anything that I'm willing to show anybody.
data.author: Abraham Verghese

data.quote: You will not find poetry anywhere unless you bring some of it with you.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: Publishing a volume of verse is like dropping a rose petal down the Grand Canyon and waiting for the echo.
data.author: Don Marquis

data.quote: Poetry is what Milton saw when he went blind.
data.author: Don Marquis

data.quote: All voices are important, and yet it seems that people of color have a lot to say, particularly if you look through the poetry of young people - a lot of questions and a lot of concerns about immigration and security issues, you name it - big questions.

data.quote: I gave my voice to poetry.
data.author: Juan Felipe Herrera

data.quote: Poetry, as odd as it is, and as hard to figure out as it is, many times, it's almost something that we're used to. It's kind of like a dream language that we had centuries ago, so that when we speak poetically or write a poem about what's going on, a real difficult issue that's facing our communities, people listen.
data.author: Juan Felipe Herrera

data.quote: San Diego shaped me a lot. The visual landscapes, the emotional panoramas, the teachers and mentors I had from the third grade through San Diego High - it's all a big part of the poetry fountain that I continue to drink from.
data.author: Juan Felipe Herrera

data.quote: The banner of the project is 'Casa de Colores.' Under that banner, I'm going to invite people to do a lot of good things. Perhaps working in groups, working on poetry.
data.author: Juan Felipe Herrera

data.quote: My mother was a washerwoman - or a woman that cleaned houses in Texas... in Plano, Texas - who always loved poetry and always loved stories.
data.author: Juan Felipe Herrera

data.quote: I write all the time - I write poetry, I love to write.
data.author: Colin Quinn

data.quote: I'm not a writer. I think I can write short stories and poetry, but film writing, brilliant film writing, is a talent - you can't just do it like that.
data.author: Samantha Morton

data.quote: It's like I understand images and some people understand poetry.
data.author: Samantha Morton

data.quote: It's bad poetry executed by people that can't sing. That's my definition of Rap.
data.author: Peter Steele

data.quote: My favorite subject probably was math. I love math. Figures just intrigue me. I was really good at math. English probably was my worst subject. But I used to write a lot of poetry. I used to write poetry all the time.
data.author: Herschel Walker

data.quote: Poetry is at the centre of my life, too, emotionally speaking, and intellectually speaking - it's just that I'm one of those people who enjoy doing other stuff as well.
data.author: Andrew Motion

data.quote: I'm not precisely saying that a really good board meeting at the MLA (Museums, Libraries and Archives Coucil) makes me want to go and write poetry, but there is a pleasure in doing that sort of thing well.
data.author: Andrew Motion

data.quote: I wish I'd been better able to resist the sense of obligation to write some of the poems I did. It's in the nature of commissioned work to be written too much from the side of your mind that knows what it's doing, which dries up the poetry.
data.author: Andrew Motion

data.quote: In a general way, I want to be a kind of flag-waver, bunting hanger-up, drum-beater, you name it, for poetry.
data.author: Andrew Motion

data.quote: Thanks partly to the kind of poets that we now have and partly to funding, there's been a gigantic shift in the way poetry is perceived... Poems on the Underground, poets in schools, football clubs, zoos.
data.author: Andrew Motion

data.quote: I wanted to reimagine the role, in a way that was respectful of its traditional responsibilities but made them part of a wider pattern of poetry about national incidents, events, preoccupations; and to spend a great deal of time going to schools trying to demystify poetry.
data.author: Andrew Motion

data.quote: More people are reading poetry now than at any time in the history of the human race.
data.author: Andrew Motion

data.quote: There is something about poetry beyond prose logic, there is mystery in it, not to be explained but admired.
data.author: Edward Young

data.quote: I got scouted for modeling on the street. I'm such a tomboy - still am. I just never thought about modeling before, but I thought, 'Ooh, interesting, similar world, perhaps it's a way into something.' Then, I was on my third photo shoot ever, and Adam Leech from 'Downtown Abbey' saw me reading poetry and asked me to recite some.

data.quote: All through childhood, I wrote verses and mysteries. There is, for me, one connection: structure. My poetry is metrical, rhyming.

data.quote: Those who have never entered upon scientific pursuits know not a tithe of the poetry by which they are surrounded.
data.author: Herbert Spencer

data.quote: I always credited my mother with inspiring me to be a writer because she was such a passionate reader. She read poetry to me as a child. data.author: Judith Viorst

data.quote: I thought it would be a funny concept to publish a book about stand-up comedy with Faber, the poetry publisher, and to apply to stand-up the same sort of weight of annotation that you would to a classic work of literature, an epic poem. I thought that would be funny.
data.author: Stewart Lee

data.quote: I accept all interpretations of my films. The only reality is before the camera. Each film I make is kind of a return to poetry for me, or at least an attempt to create a poem.
data.author: Bernardo Bertolucci

data.quote: The poet is a specialist in something which everyone practises. Herein, poetry differs from the other arts. Everyone does not practise music or painting or even dancing, but everyone without exception puts together words poetically every day of his life.
data.author: Louis MacNeice

data.quote: Everyone is not able, or inclined, to write poetry in the narrower sense any more than everyone is qualified to take part in a walking race. But just as all of us can and do walk, so all of us can and do use language poetically.
data.author: Louis MacNeice

data.quote: The rules or 'laws' of poetry are only tentative devices, an approximate scheme. There is no Sinaitic recipe for poetry, for the individual poem is the norm.
data.author: Louis MacNeice

data.quote: The novel is born of disillusionment; the poem, of despair.
data.author: Jose Bergamin

data.quote: Poetry is adolescence fermented, and thus preserved.
data.author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

data.quote: Everything is complicated; if that were not so, life and poetry and everything else would be a bore.
data.author: Wallace Stevens

data.quote: To me, art begets art. Painting feeds the eye just as poetry feeds the ear, which is to say that both feed the soul.
data.author: Susan Vreeland

data.quote: If you put a real leaf and a silk leaf side by side, you'll see something of the difference between Homer's poetry and anyone else's. There seem to be real leaves still alive in the 'Iliad,' real animals, real people, real light attending everything.

data.quote: Poetry for me is as much a spiritual practice as sexual ecstasy is.
data.author: James Broughton

data.quote: I sometimes talk about the making of a poem within the poem.
data.author: Howard Nemerov

data.quote: Everyone thinks they're going to write one book of poems or one novel.
data.author: Marilyn Hacker

data.quote: Poetry remembers that it was an oral art before it was a written art.
data.author: Jorge Luis Borges

data.quote: I know nothing new except that Herr Gellert, the Leipzig poet, is dead, and has written no more poetry since his death.

data.quote: There is one type of ideal woman very seldom described in poetry - the old maid, the woman whom sorrow or misfortune prevents from fulfilling her natural destiny.
data.author: Lafcadio Hearn

data.quote: No poem is easily grasped so why should any reader expect fast results?
data.author: John Barton

data.quote: Sometimes poetry is inspired by the conversation entered into by reading other poems.
data.author: John Barton

data.quote: An experienced reader uses the poem as an agent of inquiry. This makes poetry very exciting, unstable, and interactive.
data.author: John Barton

data.quote: I studied poetry in college and for a year in an MFA program. As time went on, my poems got more and more complicated. What I was really trying to do was tell stories.
data.author: Jennifer McMahon

data.quote: I like poems that are little games.
data.author: Peter Davison

data.quote: I'm quite sure that most writers would sustain real poetry if they could, but it takes devotion and talent.
data.author: Marguerite Young

data.quote: I was always making up rhymes. But I never thought that poetry would become my life.
data.author: Saul Williams

data.quote: Science and art, or by the same token, poetry and prose differ from one another like a journey and an excursion. The purpose of the journey is its goal, the purpose of an excursion is the process.
data.author: Franz Grillparzer

data.quote: I'll try anything, but the pig testicles in Taiwan were a little much. Eh, it wasn't half bad. There was this one dish I had there, the translation is, 'The Monk Jumps over the Fence.' It's a fish dish with all these spices. It was beautiful, man - it was poetry. It had a whole story.
data.author: Steven Adams

data.quote: Poetry is a beautiful way of spoiling prose, and the laborious art of exchanging plain sense for harmony.
data.author: Horace Walpole

data.quote: I believe in the power of poetry, which gives me reasons to look ahead and identify a glint of light.
data.author: Mahmoud Darwish

data.quote: I see poetry as spiritual medicine.
data.author: Mahmoud Darwish

data.quote: Against barbarity, poetry can resist only by confirming its attachment to human fragility like a blade of grass growing on a wall while armies march by.
data.author: Mahmoud Darwish

data.quote: That sense of a life in natural objects, which in most poetry is but a rhetorical artifice, was, then, in Wordsworth the assertion of what was for him almost literal fact.

data.quote: Still, language is resilient, and poetry when it is pressured simply goes underground.
data.author: Diane Wakoski

data.quote: I really love poetry. I'm a big E.E. Cummings fan and a big Walt Whitman fan, and I have a big book of poetry.
data.author: Mae Whitman
