data.author: Eavan Boland

data.quote: Usually a life turned into a poem is misrepresented.
data.author: Mark Strand

data.quote: Pain is filtered in a poem so that it becomes finally, in the end, pleasure.
data.author: Mark Strand

data.quote: You don't help people in your poems. I've been trying to help people all my life - that's my trouble.
data.author: Charles Olson

data.quote: There'll always be working people in my poems because I grew up with them, and I am a poet of memory.
data.author: Philip Levine

data.quote: I wonder if I ever thought of an ideal reader... I guess when I was in my 20s and in New York and maybe even in my early 30s, I would write for my wife Janice... mainly for my poet friends and my wife, who was very smart about poetry.
data.author: Kenneth Koch

data.quote: We all need ways to express ourselves, and poetry is one of mine.
data.author: Jack Prelutsky

data.quote: Poetry seems to sink into us the way prose doesn't. I can still quote verses I learned when I was very young, but I have trouble remembering one line of a novel I just finished reading.
data.author: Jack Prelutsky

data.quote: Children seem naturally drawn to poetry - it's some combination of the rhyme, rhythm, and the words themselves.
data.author: Jack Prelutsky

data.quote: I started out as a writer. Poetry and prose and also kind of satirical David Sedaris-esque stuff.
data.author: Pauley Perrette

data.quote: Eloquence is the poetry of prose.
data.author: William C. Bryant

data.quote: The first function of poetry is to tell the truth, to learn how to do that, to find out what you really feel and what you really think.
data.author: June Jordan

data.quote: I wanted to write the kind of poetry that people read and remembered, that they lived by - the kinds of lines that I carried with me from moment to moment on a given day without even having chosen to.
data.author: Tracy K. Smith

data.quote: I come here to speak poetry. It will always be in the grass. It will also be necessary to bend down to hear it. It will always be too simple to be discussed in assemblies.
data.author: Boris Pasternak

data.quote: That is to say, epic poetry has been invented many times and independently; but, as the needs which prompted the invention have been broadly similar, so the invention itself has been.
data.author: Lascelles Abercrombie

data.quote: Do-gooders are easily overlooked. We're supposed to be soft, touchy-feely types, who wear Birkenstocks, compost everything, and write poetry by candlelight.
data.author: Nancy Lublin

data.quote: The same people who are murdered slowly in the mechanized slaughterhouses of work are also arguing, singing, drinking, dancing, making love, holding the streets, picking up weapons and inventing a new poetry.
data.author: Raoul Vaneigem

data.quote: You don't have to suffer to be a poet adolescence is enough suffering for anyone.
data.author: John Ciardi

data.quote: Poetry lies its way to the truth.
data.author: John Ciardi

data.quote: I used to write sonnets and various things, and moved from there into writing prose, which, incidentally, is a lot more interesting than poetry, including the rhythms of prose.
data.author: Shelby Foote

data.quote: Poetry is the mother-tongue of the human race.
data.author: Johann Georg Hamann

data.quote: Even when poetry has a meaning, as it usually has, it may be inadvisable to draw it out... Perfect understanding will sometimes almost extinguish pleasure.
data.author: A. E. Housman

data.quote: If you read quickly to get through a poem to what it means, you have missed the body of the poem.
data.author: M. H. Abrams

data.quote: I think there are things in my story that have helped my creativity. Your father being killed, for instance, is one of the best things that could happen to a kid if he's going to write poetry or songs.
data.author: Roger Waters

data.quote: We all write poems it is simply that poets are the ones who write in words.
data.author: John Fowles

data.quote: Poetry is the deification of reality.
data.author: Edith Sitwell

data.quote: No, what I should really like to do right now, in the full blaze of lights, before this illustrious assembly, is to shower every one of you with gifts, with flowers, with offerings of poetry - to be young once more, to ride on the crest of the wave.
data.author: Knut Hamsun

data.quote: Cut quarrels out of literature, and you will have very little history or drama or fiction or epic poetry left.
data.author: Robert Staughton Lynd

data.quote: I think that one possible definition of our modern culture is that it is one in which nine-tenths of our intellectuals can't read any poetry.
data.author: Randall Jarrell

data.quote: To a poet the mere making of a poem can seem to solve the problem of truth, but only a problem of art is solved in poetry.
data.author: Laura Riding

data.quote: The end of poetry is not to create a physical condition which shall give pleasure to the mind... The end of poetry is not an after-effect, not a pleasurable memory of itself, but an immediate, constant and even unpleasant insistence upon itself.
data.author: Laura Riding

data.quote: Well, I write a lot of poetry - that's where it usually all starts. I definitely want to show you guys sides of me - love, loss, heartbreak - all of that good stuff!
data.author: Tristan Wilds

data.quote: Each memorable verse of a true poet has two or three times the written content.
data.author: Alfred de Musset

data.quote: However, if a poem can be reduced to a prose sentence, there can't be much to it.
data.author: James Schuyler

data.quote: I used to joke that if acting didn't work out, poetry was my commonsense fallback.
data.author: Merritt Wever

data.quote: I wrote poetry, journals, and, especially, plays for the neighborhood kids to perform. I had an ordinary, happy childhood. Nothing much was going on, but I had fun.
data.author: Alex Flinn

data.quote: Society's dark hull drifts further and further away. It is this place - the place of our separation, our distinction - that much of his poetry occupies.
data.author: Tomas Transtromer

data.quote: I was kind of an outcast in school 'cause I always kept to myself and was writing poetry and then going on tour with my brother band all the time, so kids didn't know what to make of me.
data.author: Christina Perri

data.quote: And inasmuch as the bridge is a symbol of all such poetry as I am interested in writing it is my present fancy that a year from now I'll be more contented working in an office than ever before.
data.author: Hart Crane

data.quote: Painting (like poetry) chooses from universals what is most apposite. It brings together, in a single imaginary being, circumstances and characteristics which occur in nature in many different persons.
data.author: Francisco Goya

data.quote: The job of the poet is to render the world - to see it and report it without loss, without perversion. No poet ever talks about feelings. Only sentimental people do.
data.author: Mark Van Doren

data.quote: Reality only reveals itself when it is illuminated by a ray of poetry.
data.author: Georges Braque

data.quote: How do poems grow? They grow out of your life.
data.author: Robert Penn Warren

data.quote: The poem is a little myth of man's capacity of making life meaningful. And in the end, the poem is not a thing we see-it is, rather, a light by which we may see-and what we see is life.
data.author: Robert Penn Warren

data.quote: You don't make a poem with ideas, but with words.
data.author: Stephane Mallarme

data.quote: Freedom is poetry, taking liberties with words, breaking the rules of normal speech, violating common sense. Freedom is violence.
data.author: Norman O. Brown

data.quote: I intended an Ode, And it turned to a Sonnet.
data.author: Henry Austin Dobson

data.quote: A poem can have an impact, but you can't expect an audience to understand all the nuances.
data.author: Douglas Dunn

data.quote: I've always written poetry and lyrics. My first husband, who was a musician, we wrote a bunch of songs together.
data.author: P. J. Soles

data.quote: There is the view that poetry should improve your life. I think people confuse it with the Salvation Army.
data.author: John Ashbery

data.quote: Don't call my lyrics poetry. It's an insult to real poets.
data.author: Bernie Taupin

data.quote: I don't look on poetry as closed works. I feel they're going on all the time in my head and I occasionally snip off a length.
data.author: John Ashbery

data.quote: The mystic purchases a moment of exhilaration with a lifetime of confusion; and the confusion is infectious and destructive. It is confusing and destructive to try and explain anything in terms of anything else, poetry in terms of psychology.
data.author: Basil Bunting

data.quote: I've been surprised to learn how many people love poetry. It's beautiful to see that people want poetry in their lives.
data.author: Peleg Top
